title: Einstein said that insanity is doing the same thing over… expecting different results… Has 20 years of the man who crushed the pound shown that Lewis has to go? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.”— comment recorded in a Knoxville Al-Anon meeting in 1981— ie. NOT Albert Einstein “Insanity is repeating the same mistakes and expecting different results.”— Rita Mae brown (Sudden Death) Insanity Is Doing the Same Thing Over and Over Again and Expecting Different Results Einstein never said thatEven if he had, Einsteins opinion of what constitutes insanity is not a sound reason that “Lewis must go” (this would be Clive Lewis?)Having Lewis around for 20 years does not mean he must go … however, if he is deemed incompetent for his job, that would be a good reason for him to go. You’d have to show that, not just make assertions.There is a “sacrificial king who brings fertility to the land” mentality to a lot of politics… if the country does not prosper under a government, then it must go and maybe we fare better under the new guys? It’s a fallacy. Base your arguments on evidence… if Lewis must, indeed, go … then make your case. Link the actions to the results.
